alert.note: Alert for Niobrara (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 22 at 9:55PM MDT until June 23 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southern Niobrara County in east central Wyoming... * Until 200 AM MDT. * At 955 PM MDT, emergency management reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain in Lusk. The Niobrara River was reported out of its banks near Lusk. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lusk, Manville, Keeline and Van Tassell. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
